citations.narrative:
The corrective action to correct and maintain the appropriate indoor housing lighting for 9 white-tailed deer was not
completed until 12/2/2022. This resulted in the white-tailed deer receiving continued excessive illumination in their
enclosures resulting in behavioral stress and weight loss. Research facilities are responsible to ensure that all research
personnel understand and provide the basic needs of research animals. Ensure that all personnel involved in animal
research, including maintenance personnel involved with animal care, receive training and instruction on the basic needs
of white-tailed deer, including the importance of diurnal lighting. Corrected prior to inspection.

Signs of behavioral stress and weight loss in 9 white-tailed deer on a research study being investigated by the veterinary
staff resulted in the research facility determining on 10/31/2022 that the automatic lighting cycle in the building where the
white-tailed deer were housed was not working properly, with the white-tailed deer receiving 24-hour lighting. The failure
of the lighting cycle resulted in the white-tailed deer receiving excessive amounts of illumination, causing distress and
affecting physical well-being. Lighting in indoor housing needs to be of a duration appropriate for the species involved.
Repair and maintain the lighting cycle in the indoor housing so that the duration of lighting is appropriate for the species
being maintained. Corrected prior to inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representatives.
End of report.
